resources.string: A scathing satire on a society in the not so distant future; The movie was too string for some to stomach in 1971
By-the-numbers tale; Despite insightful moments, film wallows in cliches and plot contrivances
Premise is so far-fetched that it keeps you watching just to find out how it\'s going to resolve itself.
Dissapointing; We learn very little about the man; Despite its length, the film is surprisingly sketchy
Makes its satiric points early on, then has nothing to add; The lead actor gives a dynamic performance in this swollen and congested film.
It became a hit and spawned a number of truly terrible imitations
"Movies where a national landmark gets destoyed"
Opens with such a hilarious, surprising sequence that nothing can top it - and nothing does. No real story follows; Crude jokes and missed opportunities
This is one family film that adults can enjoy right along with their kids. Enduring(and often very funny) tale. Oscar winning special effects.
Full of one liners. The main character is so likeable.
"Movies that have the word 'house' in the title"
The action scenes are visceral and effective, but the story bogs down and the faces of the female characters are lifeless.
Broad comedy is enthusuastically performed but thin as tissue paper
Harrowing; Not for the faint of heart
Well-acted film based on a real-life figure; only problem is finding a reason to care about him.
Some real laughs, but many hair-raising and painfully uncomfortable moments as well.
Long, tedious tale; Dissapointing; The story is overlong, repetitive, and aloof.
No narration, no music, just great film making.
Well written and well-acted; more provactive and entertaining than many glossy Hollywood movies of the 90\'s.
Eye popping photography; White-knuckle stunts; Tons of fun; Story is thin, though.
Runs on pure adrenaline and never lets up, with some good shocks and a formidable creature.
Crisp action thriller; Builds interesting characterications, then tosses credibility down the drain during the climax
"Megastupid; Good actors can only do so much with a script this dumb, and dozens of explosions and stunts don't make enough difference."
"Silly premise may entertain fans with the attention span of a beagle; The action doesn't let up."
"Films that take place all in one day"
"Fast, surprisingly funny, bloodletter is still only marginally brainier than the lead actor's previous film."
Stupendously unbelievable; Lots of violent, large-scale action, and lots of fun- just dont look for lots of logic
Dynamite Action Yarn; Marred only by overlength and too many needlessly stupid supporting characters.
Incredible-but-true story; The main actor\'s performances and the flavorful atmosphere obscure the fact that this is much ado about nothing.
"Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood"
A dopey B monster movie elevated(only slightly) by some impressive effects.
Unlikely premise is made possible by the lead\'s persuasive performance; State-of-the-art digital animation.
Feel-good film covers fresh territory in a strictly formulaic way
Intelligent thriller, set against a rich tableau
Pleasant but aimless comedy; Seems to go on forever
Crackerjack thriller; Never takes a breath!
"For a 'fun' film this is pretty bleak;"
Loud, silly and only occasionally funny
Two thirds of a terrific movie; Silly plotting and dialogue; Action scenes are powerfully good.
Starts off extremely funny, then wanders through self-serious ruminations before regaining momentum for a bright finish.
A story of redemption and faith, with moments that are pure magic; Maintains the right note from start to finish.
Draws you in with its intriguing story, black comedy, and flamboyant visuals, then shifts tone.
Smart and funny; Pushes the envelope for sexual content but never loses sight of real emotions
"You either go along with the serious and comedic whimsy of the film or you dont(we didn't); Its a long journey"
"Scorching and profane; Never succeeds in being anything but a photographed play, but when the play and the actors are this good it's hard to complain"
The violence is (necessarily) harsh and off-putting; exceptional cast
This movie improves on each viewing, with endless twists and turns that are funny, moving, and even profound
"Movies where Tom Cruise has long hair"
Good actors in the leads and a distinctive goofball vibe are definite assets, but a spotty script too often fails to deliver on its promise.
Harold And Kumar Go To White Castle
A fascinating, multilayered character study studded with gripping action scenes; Overlength is the only criticism of this crackerjack contemporary drama.
Sacrifices genuine scares and for gratuitous gore and nonstop profanity;
Often enthraling; Adapted by a British series of books; Only resorts to formula storytelling at the climax
Benefits from the leading mans charisma and physicality but falls back on horror cliches.
Interersting premise is squandered by this obvious and overlong film; Cartoonish special effects.
"Films where someone is frozen to death"
Hip spoof film; Lose and good natured, with some laugh-out-loud gags;
"Films where someone wears someone else's face"
Spectacular and spectacularly stupid; Special effects are impressive; The human stories are so dump and the writing is so lame.
"Unappealing, unrelenting, and (after awhile) downright boring. The Actors can't be faulted."
Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles
A rare case of a bubble-gum story scoring a terrific movie.
Cute, funny romantic comedy; goes on to long given the finale is a forgone conclusion;The leading man is charming
"Stupid and proud of it; Setups for laugh lines or visual punch lines are muffed tome and tome again. What a waste"
Well produced and suspenseful, but we\'ve seen it all before and it never really catches fire.
Loses some momentum in the second half but still a knockout; Only way to really appreciate this film is on the big screen.
Only this director would take on the challenge of such a film - and succeed
Their gradual degeneration is compelling; Adapted from a novel;
A mosaic of misery; Fine performances in this emotionally exausting film
Sweet film; Parents and dog lovers should approach with caution; The movie follows the dogs life to the very end.
Great effects and animation but awfully broad and one-note in tone
Heavier on atmosphere than on story; The Human element is nicely played and the physical production is impressive.
Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
Sounds awfully familiar. Reverts to formula, but still a cut above the norm.
"Pretentious; Plays with storytelling conventions and juggles 'real time', but adds up to zero."
Outrageous and original at every turn; Sharp pacing that never lets up; Snappy script
Watchable on a make-believe level but the final showdown is awfully conventional
Smart, interesting drama; Based on a best-selling book;
"Its not to be taken seriously; Not your parent's romantic star vehicle."
Film is less stomach-churning by today\'s standards, yet its essential power to chill remains undeminished despite scores of imitations.
Amusing film that never quite takes off. Leaves most of its laughs to individual moments.
"Avoids hollywood clichés; Emotions are stripped raw."
Films featuring Orlando Bloom or Orlando Jones
Blends fantasy and fearsome vilence; Invites repeated viewings
Makes no sense whatsoever; Annoying film; The lead gives a tour-de-force performance.
Stylishly designed and shot, with rollicking performances; This depends more on special effects.
Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
Incredible, mind-numbing plotline; Fast Moving direction by the director
Paced like a roller-coaster ride, with dazzling special effects; Sensationally scary.
Loaded with ideas and imagination; Occasionally bogs down in technical jargon, but still well worth watching.
The score adds much to the excitement
Stylishly made, but also emotionally distant, with stabs at social and cultural meaning
"The violent, pumped-up movie isn't for every taste - certainly not for the squemish - but its got more vitality than almost any other film of 1994."
"Films that have a focus on Air Travel or Airplanes"
"Movies that Dennis or Randy Quaid act in"
Feast for the eyes; Fine voice work
A bleak tale; It\'s hard to care about anyone in this dour story.
Flashy, maybe too flashy; Nearly every performance is better than expected.
Not Bad. Helped by two leads\' likable performances.
Simply entertains with lots of large scale action and special effects.
Brain dead yahoo fare is fun for a while
The love story is bland and weighs down the movie; The movie is just a collection of caricatures and cliches
Rock-solid. Immensely entertaining. Well acted crowd pleaser.
"Movies that have an all male cast"
Most realistic, relentlessly harrowing footage ever committed to a fiction film.
L-o-o-o-o-o-w brow spoof; Raunchy and raucous, with gags that would embarrass a fret boy.
It can be silly at times but when it sticks to the scary stuff it makes you jump.
Stylish, but completely artificial; The excitement of watching these images soon dies off but the film refuses to do the same.
"You know what you're getting with this film; The premise is fun, but a premise is just about all there is."
"Baroque art style is film's major virtue, but that can't overcome its many faults, including a boring, familiar, illogical plot."
A bit hokey and pretentious at times, but a likeable adventure overall, with nice touches of warmth and humor.
"Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan"
Clever concept; It has a fine cast;Creative visual interpretation.
An overblow, effects-laden turky; This film has far less appeal then the source that inspired it.
Knocks your socks off; Lacks freshness.
"Once it kicks into gear, its brutally unrelenting toward its unappealing characters - and the audience; Completely lacks the leavening sense of humor that enhanced the original."
The director in grand fashion uses Technicolor and all forms of movie magic was used for the film;
The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
"The characters are likeable, the dialogue isn't dumb, and the effects are spectacular"
"Films, that when filmed, took place in the future but no longer do"
Big, lively, and exceptionally noisy; An old fashioned adventure yarn; A likeable bunch
Occasionally raunchy but ingeniously plotted and well acted.
Silly and predictable;The lead character is ditzy but endearing
"Creates a moodiness that's intriguing enough to allow a willing viewer to go along for the ride"
This film flirts with greatness but falls short; Still, there is much to admire, including strong performances
"Filled with 1990's sensebilities, potent depiction of violence, and a charismatic central performance."
Dazzling scenics; Some Drama not suited for your viewers
Well made, well acted;Suffers from over-abundant, heavy-handed images.
Cutting edge visuals with an overlong script; Has a tendency to keep changing its own complicated rules.
Amazing, unique effects, charcaters, and visual design.
"Delightful remake that doesn't lose the appeal of the original"
Noisy, exciting action but its characters and story points are bathed in cliche.
A manic performance that makes Jim Carrey look like Ben Kingsley; The lead actor is talented but this is a poor showcase.
Up-beat, feel good movie; Based on a true story
Innocuous film; incredibly condescending, heavy handed narration.
Intriguing but fails to reach the desired effects of the original source material; Some eerie scenes for sure, but the film goes on forever.
Almost unbearably intense and brilliantly acted.
The director asks us to accept a sweet, optimistic fable - not easy for some people to do these days.
Faithful to the original story but nonstop parade of repulsive special effects turns this into a freak show and drowns the suspense
The concept is difficult to embrace; Maintains an extremely delicate and light tone throughout.
Terrific cast; Highly praised, but to our minds, too clever for its own good.
Spectacualr in every way; The young leads have magnetic performances; Storytelling savvy and momentum make up for some boring dialogue.
"The top billed actor is named Bill(or William, or any derivative thereof)"
"Colorful cast of characters; A grownup story masqueradingas a kid's film"
Starts off strongly and then gets dumber and dumber, abandoning credibility for melodrama, coincidences, and a cartoonlike climax.
"They squeeze all the humor they can out of a paper-thin script- but even they can't make up for a bummer of an ending."
The pace too often plodding, the performances wildly uneven, and the script crammed with laughable cliches
An irresistible main character, and a dynamite opening sequence; Becomes heavy-handed in its message
"Films featuring Joe Pantliano(Joey Pants) or John Leguizamo(Johnny Legs)"
"Films featuring atleast one of the members of the Wayans family"
"Moves that take place on a farm"
Logic is set aside in this one; A series of broad, silly riffs, poking fun at stereotypical people.
This raunchy, entertaining neo-noir has more twists than a pretzel factory; Gorgeously photographed and well played, it never takes itself too seriously.
Rehash of a 1960s tv series; Overstuffed with visual gimmickry, but dull in every way.
"Movies where Will Smith saves a cat"
Shortchanges character development in favor of explosions and special effects
Most categories were pulled from the Reddit subreddit r/lmgcategories. Other categories were taken from the podcast submitted by twitter users who I tried to thank below.

"If I failed to give you credit for a category you created or I spelled your twitter handle wrong please email me and I'll make the changes. I couldn\'t give credit to many of the categories found on reddit because the users deleted their accounts."
All credit goes to Doug Benson for the game idea
This app was entirely fan made. Doug Benson plays the Leonard Maltin Game on his podcast Doug Loves Movies.

"The game begins and moves counter-clockwise from Player 1.

At the start of each round a player will choose a category and a year that the mystery movie is in.

The players will receive clues about the movie based on what Leonard Maltin wrote in his review to help with guessing the movie title.

Now a round of bidding begins where the players bid on how many names they think they need to hear, starting from the bottom of the casting list, to name the movie.

For example, if the movie is Star Wars and you say you can name it in 2 names you're not going to get Mark Hamill and Harrison Ford, you're going to get the bottom 2 actors on the casting list.

You want to use all the clues and names given to you to guess the movie's title.

If you dont think you can name it in less names than the player before you, you can force them to try to guess the movie. If the person you challenged guesses wrong, you get the point. If they guess right, they get the point.

A new round begins after the movie is revealed.

The first player to reach the chosen points to win, wins the game!"

string.name: goal_text
string.p: Try to guess the movie based on the given clues. Guess the right movie, you get a point. If you guess wrong, the player that forced you to make a guess gets the point.

resources.string: Email categories and their movies to adelprete87@gmail.com. Each category must have atleast 3 movies. You may also send over movies that fit existing categories that are not in the game.
All movie images were taken from themoviedb.org
A lot of credit also goes to the Leonard Maltin 2015 Movie Guide
The Leonard Maltin 2015 Movie Guide was used for movie ratings and review snippets. The app, along with IMDB, helped shape each movies casting list
Force the player before you to name the movie
Can you name it with less names?
Say aloud the names listed above and the title of the movie that you think it is.
"Once you've announced your guess, reveal the title of the movie."

I recommend that one player be the designated reader and reads everything displayed on the screen similar to how Doug Benson does it on his podcast. The only difference here is that everyone can play, including the reader. If you want to pass the phone around to each person on their turn, that can work too.

"Million Dollar Baby Arm - @Topiaryskeleton
Sausagefest - @clayHansen1
Whose Line is it Anyway - @Nateheadhadley
We Are Farmers - @Mantitebow
Arch Enemies - @Cuntatron
Smaug Life - @Errantparadigm
Row vs Wade - JeffTcaro"
Perfect Dorm - @kojiwerner
